choices.text:
Chicken Tikka Masala

Serving size: 4

Nutrition info per serving: 
Calories: 339 
Total fat: 19.9 g 
Saturated fat: 6.8 g 
Cholesterol: 111.3 mg 
Sodium: 608.3 mg 
Total Carbohydrate: 18.3 g 
Dietary Fiber: 3.4 g 
Sugars: 10.5 g 
Protein: 24.4 g 
Ingredients: 
•	2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized cubes 
•	2 tablespoons olive oil 
•	1 large onion, chopped 
•	2 cloves garlic, minced 
•	2 tablespoons garam masala 
•	1 tablespoon ground cumin 
•	1 tablespoon ground turmeric 
•	1 teaspoon ground coriander 
•	1 teaspoon ground ginger 
•	1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper 
•	1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes 
•	2 tablespoons tomato paste 
•	2 cups chicken broth 
•	1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt 
•	1 large eggplant, peeled and cubed 
•	2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro 
•	Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions: 

1. Preheat oven to 400°F.

2. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until lightly browned, about 6 minutes. Transfer to a plate and set aside.

3. Add remaining oil to the same skillet and heat over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.

4. Add the garam masala, cumin, turmeric, coriander, ginger, and cayenne. Cook for 1 minute.

5. Stir in the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.

6. Add the chicken back to the skillet, along with the Greek yogurt, eggplant cubes, and cilantro. Cook, stirring occasionally, until eggplant is tender, about 10 minutes.

7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15
